page.title: 15Transport in rural Dyfed.
page.content: Apart from the B4309 road,which runs from Carmarthen to Llanelli,and the B4317,which runs from Pontyates to Pontyberem,which are 2 laned,the rest of the roads in this area are single track with passing places.Two bus companies run services on the main roads.They are South Wales Transport and Eynons Buses. British Rail own the mineral railway which runs past Cynheidre.This railway was first opened in the early 19th century to transport coal,limestone and iron ore to Llanelli.No coal has been transported on this line since the Miners' strike of 1984-85.This was a decision made by British Rail.The coal is now transported by road so the number of large lorries on the B4309 is greatly increased.
